meanings.definition: The state of being in poor condition or needing repair.
meanings.sent1: The old house was in disrepair, with broken windows and a leaky roof.
meanings.sent2: The playground equipment had fallen into disrepair over the years.
meanings.sent3: The disrepair of the car made it look like a forgotten relic from the past.
meanings.sent4: The disrepair of the bridge mirrored the neglect of the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The disrepair of the building was a stark reminder of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: To fall into a state of disrepair.
meanings.sent1: The neglected garden began to disrepair as weeds took over.
meanings.sent2: Without proper maintenance, the machinery will disrepair quickly.
meanings.sent3: The lack of care caused the bicycle to disrepair faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: The road started to disrepair, showing cracks and potholes everywhere.
meanings.sent5: Leaving the boat out in the sun caused it to disrepair faster than usual.
